intro: Croton holguinensis, commonly known as the Holguín croton, is a species of flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the genus Croton in the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, colorful leaves that display a range of shades, often with contrasting patterns. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
